    About Us

    Empower the disadvantaged groups (disabled, children and elderly) of Khayelitsha, especially youth by edifying of their values and abilities. Moreover, restoring lost hope from the youth of Khayelitsha and provide support through the process of supervising and restoration of their dreams.

    Lorem Ipsum

    Assist the youth through entrepreneurial and leadership development, educational support and life skills; provide possible opportunity through partnership with individuals, organizations and other stakeholders who share the same vision and above all to create a healthy environment for our youth.

    Nemo Enim

    To develop programmes that will improve the living standards of the youth by educating and training members of the group on technical skills leadership and entrepreneurial development. Developing partnership with private and public organizations and providing forums for sharing experiences and best practices.

    01

    Lorem Ipsum

    Empowering the disadvantaged groups, especially the youth by enhancing self-confidence, self- awareness and self-reliance.

    02

    Repellat Nihil

    Providing educational support such as tutoring, mentorship to improve education level in the area, as well as broadening the horizons of local youth.

    03

    Ad ad velit qui

    Providing entrepreneurial and leadership development from the governmental agencies and private institutions to edify and equip unemployed youth with entrepreneurship skills and merge black owned businesses from local youth.

    04

    Repellendus molestiae

    Creating a youth hub space that will provide space for development for the youth and other community members as well.

    05

    Sapiente Magnam

    Providing psychological support from qualified social workers and psychologists as well as seek for customary assistance from local elders (older women and men).

    06

    Facilis Impedit

    Generating jobs opportunity for the unemployed youth as well as unemployed graduates and bridging a link between local graduates and children that are still at school.
